017package com.github.tommyettinger.colorful.cielab;
018
019import com.badlogic.gdx.Gdx;
020import com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.*;
021import com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.Batch;
022import com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.TextureRegion;
023import com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.glutils.ShaderProgram;
024import com.badlogic.gdx.math.Affine2;
025import com.badlogic.gdx.math.MathUtils;
026import com.badlogic.gdx.math.Matrix4;
027import com.badlogic.gdx.utils.NumberUtils;
028
029import java.nio.Buffer;
030
031/**
032 * A substitute for {@link com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.SpriteBatch} that adds an additional attribute to store an
033 * extra color's worth of channels, used to modify the L, A, and B channels of a color by multiplication (called the
034 * "tweak") while the primary color affects the color additively (just called the color, often drawn from
035 * {@link Palette} or generated with {@link ColorTools}). This ColorfulBatch uses the CIELAB color space where
036 * SpriteBatch normally uses RGBA, which means that in the batch color, red maps to additive L (lightness), green maps
037 * to additive A (green-to-red), blue maps to additive B (violet-to-yellow), and alpha continues to be multiplicative
038 * alpha. Additive values cause no change when they are 0.5, but cause a sharp increase at 1.0 and a sharp decrease at
039 * 0.0. In the tweak, red maps to multiplicative L, green maps to multiplicative A, blue maps to multiplicative B, and
040 * alpha maps to "exponential-like" contrast. Like with the additive values, 0.5 causes no change for multiplicative
041 * values, but you can think of the existing color as being temporarily shifted down by 0.5 for each of the LAB
042 * channels, so each LAB channel's range is -0.5 to 0.5 before being multiplied by the corresponding tweak value (times
043 * 2.0, which means multiplicative tweak values for A and B that are less than 0.5 make colors closer to grayscale and
044 * values greater than 0.5 make colors more vibrant) and then shifted back to its prior range. Contrast is a special
045 * value; 0.5 still means "no change," but lower values will make L changes less distinct between similar colors, while
046 * higher values will "sharpen" the changes in L.
047 * <br>
048 * Created by Tommy Ettinger on 1/21/2021.
049 */
050public class ColorfulBatch implements Batch {
051    public static final int SPRITE_SIZE = 24;
052    public static final String TWEAK_ATTRIBUTE = "a_tweak";
053
054    private Mesh mesh;
055
056    private final float[] vertices;
057    private int idx = 0;
058    private Texture lastTexture = null;
059    private float invTexWidth = 0, invTexHeight = 0;
060
061    private boolean drawing = false;
062
063    private final Matrix4 transformMatrix = new Matrix4();
064    private final Matrix4 projectionMatrix = new Matrix4();
065    private final Matrix4 combinedMatrix = new Matrix4();
066
067    private boolean blendingDisabled = false;
068    private int blendSrcFunc = GL20.GL_SRC_ALPHA;
069    private int blendDstFunc = GL20.GL_ONE_MINUS_SRC_ALPHA;
070    private int blendSrcFuncAlpha = GL20.GL_SRC_ALPHA;
071    private int blendDstFuncAlpha = GL20.GL_ONE_MINUS_SRC_ALPHA;
072
073    private final ShaderProgram shader;
074    private ShaderProgram customShader = null;
075    private boolean ownsShader;
076
077    protected float color = Palette.GRAY;
078    private final Color tempColor = new Color(0.5372549f, 0.49411765f, 0.49019608f, 1f); // LAB from Palette.GRAY
079
080    /**
081     * A constant packed float that can be assigned to this ColorfulBatch's tweak with {@link #setTweak(float)} to make
082     * all of the tweak adjustments virtually imperceptible. When this is set as the tweak, it won't change the
083     * L multiplier or contrast, and it won't change the A multiplier or the B multiplier.
084     */
085    public static final float TWEAK_RESET = ColorTools.cielab(0.5f, 0.5f, 0.5f, 0.5f);
086    protected float tweak = TWEAK_RESET;
087
088    /** Number of render calls since the last {@link #begin()}. **/
089    public int renderCalls = 0;
090
091    /** Number of rendering calls, ever. Will not be reset unless set manually. **/
092    public int totalRenderCalls = 0;
093
094    /** The maximum number of sprites rendered in one batch so far. **/
095    public int maxSpritesInBatch = 0;
096
097    /** Constructs a new ColorfulBatch with a size of 1000, one buffer, and the default shader.
098     * @see #ColorfulBatch(int, ShaderProgram) */
099    public ColorfulBatch() {
100        this(1000, null);
101    }
102
103    /** Constructs a ColorfulBatch with one buffer and the default shader.
104     * @see #ColorfulBatch(int, ShaderProgram)  */
105    public ColorfulBatch(int size) {
106        this(size, null);
107    }
108
109    /** Constructs a new ColorfulBatch. Sets the projection matrix to an orthographic projection with y-axis point upwards, x-axis
110     * point to the right and the origin being in the bottom left corner of the screen. The projection will be pixel perfect with
111     * respect to the current screen resolution.
112     * <p>
113     * The defaultShader specifies the shader to use. Note that the names for uniforms for this default shader are different than
114     * the ones expect for shaders set with {@link #setShader(ShaderProgram)}. See {@link #createDefaultShader()}.
115     * @param size The max number of sprites in a single batch. Max of 16383.
116     * @param defaultShader The default shader to use. This is not owned by the ColorfulBatch and must be disposed separately. */
117    public ColorfulBatch(int size, ShaderProgram defaultShader) {
118        // 65535 is max vertex index, so 65535 / 4 vertices per sprite = 16383 sprites max.
119        if (size > 16383) throw new IllegalArgumentException("Can't have more than 16383 sprites per batch: " + size);
120
121        Mesh.VertexDataType vertexDataType = (Gdx.gl30 != null) ? Mesh.VertexDataType.VertexBufferObjectWithVAO : Mesh.VertexDataType.VertexArray;
122
123        mesh = new Mesh(vertexDataType, false, size * 4, size * 6,
124                new VertexAttribute(VertexAttributes.Usage.Position, 2, ShaderProgram.POSITION_ATTRIBUTE),
125                new VertexAttribute(VertexAttributes.Usage.ColorPacked, 4, ShaderProgram.COLOR_ATTRIBUTE),
126                new VertexAttribute(VertexAttributes.Usage.TextureCoordinates, 2, ShaderProgram.TEXCOORD_ATTRIBUTE + "0"),
127                new VertexAttribute(VertexAttributes.Usage.ColorPacked, 4, TWEAK_ATTRIBUTE));
128
129        projectionMatrix.setToOrtho2D(0, 0, Gdx.graphics.getWidth(), Gdx.graphics.getHeight());
130
131        vertices = new float[size * SPRITE_SIZE];
132
133        int len = size * 6;
134        short[] indices = new short[len];
135        short j = 0;
136        for (int i = 0; i < len; i += 6, j += 4) {
137            indices[i] = j;
138            indices[i + 1] = (short)(j + 1);
139            indices[i + 2] = (short)(j + 2);
140            indices[i + 3] = (short)(j + 2);
141            indices[i + 4] = (short)(j + 3);
142            indices[i + 5] = j;
143        }
144        mesh.setIndices(indices);
145
146        if (defaultShader == null) {
147            shader = createDefaultShader();
148            ownsShader = true;
149        } else
150            shader = defaultShader;
151    }
152
153    /**
154     * Makes a new instance of the default ShaderProgram used for this ColorfulBatch, without any {@code #version}
155     * specified in the shader source. This expects an extra attribute (relative to a normal SpriteBatch) that is used
156     * for the tweak. You may want to set the code to prepend before you call this, as with:
157     * {@code ShaderProgram.prependVertexCode = "#version 110\n";
158     * ShaderProgram.prependFragmentCode = "#version 110\n";}
159     * The actual version can be different, and may need to be different for compatibility with some hardware.
160     * @return a new instance of the default shader used by ColorfulBatch for GL2 when no shader is specified
161     */
162    public static ShaderProgram createDefaultShader () {
163        String vertexShader = "attribute vec4 " + ShaderProgram.POSITION_ATTRIBUTE + ";\n"
164                + "attribute vec4 " + ShaderProgram.COLOR_ATTRIBUTE + ";\n"
165                + "attribute vec2 " + ShaderProgram.TEXCOORD_ATTRIBUTE + "0;\n"
166                + "attribute vec4 " + TWEAK_ATTRIBUTE + ";\n"
167                + "uniform mat4 u_projTrans;\n"
168                + "varying vec4 v_color;\n"
169                + "varying vec4 v_tweak;\n"
170                + "varying vec2 v_texCoords;\n"
171                + "varying float v_lightFix;\n"
172                + "\n"
173                + "void main()\n"
174                + "{\n"
175                + "   v_color = " + ShaderProgram.COLOR_ATTRIBUTE + ";\n"
176                + "   v_color.w = v_color.w * (255.0/254.0);\n"
177                + "   v_tweak = " + TWEAK_ATTRIBUTE + ";\n"
178                + "   v_tweak.w = pow(v_tweak.w * (255.0/254.0) + 0.5, 1.709);\n"
179                + "   v_lightFix = 1.0 + pow(v_tweak.w, 1.41421356);\n"
180                + "   v_texCoords = " + ShaderProgram.TEXCOORD_ATTRIBUTE + "0;\n"
181                + "   gl_Position =  u_projTrans * " + ShaderProgram.POSITION_ATTRIBUTE + ";\n"
182                + "}\n";
183        String fragmentShader =
184                "#ifdef GL_ES\n" +
185                        "#define LOWP lowp\n" +
186                        "precision mediump float;\n" +
187                        "#else\n" +
188                        "#define LOWP \n" +
189                        "#endif\n" +
190                        "varying vec2 v_texCoords;\n" +
191                        "varying LOWP vec4 v_color;\n" +
192                        "varying LOWP vec4 v_tweak;\n" +
193                        "varying float v_lightFix;\n" +
194                        "uniform sampler2D u_texture;\n" +
195                        "const vec3 forward = vec3(1.0 / 3.0);\n" +
196                        "const vec3 sRGBFrom = vec3(2.4);\n" +
197                        "const vec3 sRGBThresholdFrom = vec3(0.04045);\n" +
198                        "const vec3 sRGBTo = vec3(1.0 / 2.4);\n" +
199                        "const vec3 sRGBThresholdTo = vec3(0.0031308);\n" +
200                        "const vec3 epsilon = vec3(0.00885645);\n" +
201                        "vec3 linear(vec3 t){ return mix(pow((t + 0.055) * (1.0 / 1.055), sRGBFrom), t * (1.0/12.92), step(t, sRGBThresholdFrom)); }\n" +
202                        "vec3 sRGB(vec3 t){ return mix(1.055 * pow(t, sRGBTo) - 0.055, 12.92*t, step(t, sRGBThresholdTo)); }\n" +
203                        "float xyzF(float t){ return mix(pow(t,1./3.), 7.787037 * t + 0.139731, step(t, 0.00885645)); }\n" +
204                        "vec3 xyzF(vec3 t){ return mix(pow(t, forward), 7.787037 * t + 0.139731, step(t, epsilon)); }\n" +
205                        "float xyzR(float t){ return mix(t*t*t , 0.1284185 * (t - 0.139731), step(t, 0.20689655)); }\n" +
206                        "vec3 rgb2lab(vec3 c)\n" +
207                        "{\n" +
208                        "    c *= mat3(0.4124, 0.3576, 0.1805,\n" +
209                        "              0.2126, 0.7152, 0.0722,\n" +
210                        "              0.0193, 0.1192, 0.9505);\n" +
211                        "    c = xyzF(c);\n" +
212                        "    vec3 lab = vec3(max(0.,1.16*c.y - 0.16), (c.x - c.y) * 5.0, (c.y - c.z) * 2.0); \n" +
213                        "    return lab;\n" +
214                        "}\n" +
215                        "vec3 lab2rgb(vec3 c)\n" +
216                        "{\n" +
217                        "    float lg = 1./1.16*(c.x + 0.16);\n" +
218                        "    vec3 xyz = vec3(xyzR(lg + c.y * 0.2),\n" +
219                        "                    xyzR(lg),\n" +
220                        "                    xyzR(lg - c.z * 0.5));\n" +
221                        "    vec3 rgb = xyz*mat3( 3.2406, -1.5372,-0.4986,\n" +
222                        "                        -0.9689,  1.8758, 0.0415,\n" +
223                        "                         0.0557, -0.2040, 1.0570);\n" +
224                        "    return rgb;\n" +
225                        "}\n" +
226                        "void main()\n" +
227                        "{\n" +
228                        "  vec4 tgt = texture2D( u_texture, v_texCoords );\n" +
229                        "  vec3 lab = rgb2lab(linear(tgt.rgb));\n" +
230                        "  lab.x = clamp(pow(lab.x, v_tweak.w) * v_lightFix * v_tweak.x + v_color.x - 0.5372549, 0.0, 1.0);\n" +
231                        "  lab.yz = (lab.yz * v_tweak.yz * 2.0) + (v_color.yz - 0.5) * 2.0;\n" +
232                        "  gl_FragColor = vec4(sRGB(clamp(lab2rgb(lab), 0.0, 1.0)), v_color.a * tgt.a);\n" +
233                        "}";
234        ShaderProgram shader = new ShaderProgram(vertexShader, fragmentShader);
235        if (!shader.isCompiled()) throw new IllegalArgumentException("Error compiling shader: " + shader.getLog());
236        return shader;
237    }
238
239    @Override
240    public void begin () {
241        if (drawing) throw new IllegalStateException("ColorfulBatch.end must be called before begin.");
242        renderCalls = 0;
243
244        Gdx.gl.glDepthMask(false);
245        if (customShader != null)
246            customShader.bind();
247        else
248            shader.bind();
249        setupMatrices();
250
251        drawing = true;
252    }
253
254    @Override
255    public void end () {
256        if (!drawing) throw new IllegalStateException("ColorfulBatch.begin must be called before end.");
257        if (idx > 0) flush();
258        lastTexture = null;
259        drawing = false;
260
261        GL20 gl = Gdx.gl;
262        gl.glDepthMask(true);
263        if (isBlendingEnabled()) gl.glDisable(GL20.GL_BLEND);
264    }
265
266    @Override
267    public void setColor (Color tint) {
268        color = tint.toFloatBits();
269    }
270
271    /**
272     * Sets the color to the result of {@link ColorTools#cielab(float, float, float, float)} on the same arguments.
273     * For the L/A/B parameters, 0.5f is a neutral value (causing no change), while for alpha, 1.0f is a neutral
274     * value. For L/A/B, higher values will add to the corresponding channel, while lower values will subtract from it.
275     * @see ColorTools#cielab(float, float, float, float)
276     * @param L like lightness; additive; ranges from 0 (black) to 1 (white)
277     * @param A cool-to-warm, roughly; additive; ranges from 0 (green/cyan/blue) to 1 (orange/red/purple)
278     * @param B artificial-to-natural, very roughly; additive; ranges from 0 (blue/purple) to 1 (green/yellow/orange)
279     * @param alpha opacity, from 0 to 1; multiplicative
280     */
281    @Override
282    public void setColor (float L, float A, float B, float alpha) {
283        color = ColorTools.cielab(L, A, B, alpha);
284    }
285
286    public void setColor (final float color) {
287        setPackedColor(color);
288    }
289
290    /**
291     * Expects an int color in the format (luma, 8 bits), (chroma A, 8 bits), (chroma B, 8 bits), (alpha, 7 bits),
292     * (ignored, 1 bit).
293     * @param color an int color with alpha in the least significant byte and luma in the most significant
294     */
295    public void setIntColor(final int color) {
296        this.color = NumberUtils.intBitsToFloat(Integer.reverseBytes(color & -2));
297    }
298
299    /**
300     * Sets the color with the given L/A/B and A parameters from 0 to 255.
301     * For the L/A/B parameters, 127 or 128 is a neutral value (causing no change), while for alpha, 255 is a neutral
302     * value. For L/A/B, higher values will add to the corresponding channel, while lower values will subtract from it.
303     * @see ColorTools#cielab(float, float, float, float)
304     * @param L like lightness; additive; ranges from 0 (black) to 255 (white)
305     * @param A cool-to-warm, roughly; additive; ranges from 0 (green/cyan/blue) to 255 (orange/red/purple)
306     * @param B artificial-to-natural, very roughly; additive; ranges from 0 (blue/purple) to 255 (green/yellow/orange)
307     * @param alpha opacity, from 0 to 255 (254 is equivalent, since the lowest bit is discarded); multiplicative
308     */
309    public void setIntColor(int L, int A, int B, int alpha) {
310        color = NumberUtils.intBitsToFloat((alpha << 24 & 0xFE000000)
311                | (B << 16 & 0xFF0000) | (A << 8 & 0xFF00) | (L & 0xFF));
312    }
313
314    @Override
315    public void setPackedColor (final float color) {
316        this.color = color;
317    }
318
319    @Override
320    public Color getColor () {
321        final int intBits = NumberUtils.floatToRawIntBits(color);
322        Color color = tempColor;
323        color.r = (intBits & 0xff) / 255f;
324        color.g = ((intBits >>> 8) & 0xff) / 255f;
325        color.b = ((intBits >>> 16) & 0xff) / 255f;
326        color.a = (intBits >>> 25) / 127f;
327        return color;
328    }
329
330    @Override
331    public float getPackedColor () {
332        return color;
333    }
334
335    /**
336     * Sets the multiplicative and contrast parts of the shader's color changes. 0.5 is a neutral value that should have
337     * minimal effect on the image; using {@code (0.5f, 0.5f, 0.5f, 0.5f)} will effectively remove the tweak.
338     * @param L like lightness; multiplicative; ranges from 0 (sets lightness to 0) to 1 (doubles lightness)
339     * @param A cool-to-warm, roughly; multiplicative; ranges from 0 (green and red are removed) to 1 (green-ness or red-ness is emphasized)
340     * @param B artificial-to-natural, very roughly; multiplicative; ranges from 0 (blue and yellow are removed) to 1 (blue-ness or yellow-ness is emphasized)
341     * @param contrast affects how lightness changes; ranges from 0 (low contrast, cloudy look) to 1 (high contrast, sharpened look) 
342     */
343    public void setTweak (float L, float A, float B, float contrast) {
344        tweak = ColorTools.cielab(L, A, B, contrast);
345    }
346    /**
347     * Sets the tweak using a single packed CIELAB float.
348     * @see #setTweak(float, float, float, float)
349     * @param tweak a packed CIELAB float, with contrast instead of alpha
350     */
351    public void setTweak (final float tweak) {
352        this.tweak = tweak;
353    }
354    
355    public float getTweak () {
356        return tweak;
357    }
358
359    /**
360     * Takes the tweak as an int in the format: L (8 bits), A (8 bits), B (8 bits), contrast (7 bits),
361     * (1 ignored bit at the end). An example would be 0x7820206E, which slightly darkens (with L 0x78, slightly
362     * below the halfway point of 0x80), significantly reduces colorfulness with A and B multipliers of 0x20
363     * (closer to 0, so most colors will be almost grayscale), and slightly reduces contrast (with contrast and the
364     * ignored bit as 0x6E, which is less than the halfway point).
365     * @param tweak the tweak to use as an integer, with L in the most significant bits and contrast in least
366     */
367    public void setIntTweak(final int tweak) {
368        this.tweak = NumberUtils.intBitsToFloat(Integer.reverseBytes(tweak & -2));
369    }
370
371    /**
372     * Sets the multiplicative and contrast parts of the shader's color changes. 127 is a neutral value that should have
373     * minimal effect on the image; using {@code (127, 127, 127, 127)} will effectively remove the tweak.
374     * @param L like lightness; multiplicative; ranges from 0 (black) to 255 (white)
375     * @param A cool-to-warm, roughly; multiplicative; ranges from 0 (green and red are removed) to 255 (green-ness or red-ness is emphasized)
376     * @param B artificial-to-natural, very roughly; multiplicative; ranges from 0 (blue and yellow are removed) to 255 (blue-ness or yellow-ness is emphasized)
377     * @param contrast affects how lightness changes; ranges from 0 (low contrast, cloudy look) to 255 (high contrast, sharpened look) 
378     */
379    public void setIntTweak(int L, int A, int B, int contrast) {
380        tweak = NumberUtils.intBitsToFloat((contrast << 24 & 0xFE000000)
381                | (B << 16 & 0xFF0000) | (A << 8 & 0xFF00) | (L & 0xFF));
382    }
383
384    /**
385     * A convenience method that sets both the color (with {@link #setColor(float)}) and the tweak (with
386     * {@link #setTweak(float)}) at the same time, using two packed floats.
387     * @param color the additive components and alpha, as a packed float
388     * @param tweak the multiplicative components and contrast, as a packed float
389     */
390    public void setTweakedColor(final float color, final float tweak) {
391        setColor(color);
392        setTweak(tweak);
393    }
394
395    /**
396     * A convenience method that sets both the color (with {@link #setColor(float, float, float, float)}) and the tweak
397     * (with {@link #setTweak(float, float, float, float)}) at the same time.
398     * @param addL like lightness; additive; ranges from 0 (black) to 1 (white)
399     * @param addA cool-to-warm, roughly; additive; ranges from 0 (green/cyan/blue) to 1 (orange/red/purple)
400     * @param addB artificial-to-natural, very roughly; additive; ranges from 0 (blue/purple) to 1 (green/yellow/orange)
401     * @param mulAlpha opacity, from 0 to 1; multiplicative
402     * @param mulL like lightness; multiplicative; ranges from 0 (sets all L to 0) to 1 (doubles the image's L)
403     * @param mulA cool-to-warm, roughly; multiplicative; ranges from 0 (green/cyan/blue) to 1 (orange/red/purple)
404     * @param mulB artificial-to-natural, very roughly; multiplicative; ranges from 0 (blue/purple) to 1 (green/yellow/orange)
405     * @param contrast foggy-to-sharp lightness contrast; affects most other components; ranges from 0 (flat, foggy lightness) to 1 (sharp, crisp lightness)
406     */
407    public void setTweakedColor(final float addL, final float addA,
408                                final float addB, final float mulAlpha,
409                                final float mulL, final float mulA,
410                                final float mulB, final float contrast) {
411        setColor(addL, addA, addB, mulAlpha);
412        setTweak(mulL, mulA, mulB, contrast);
413    }
414
415    @Override
416    public void draw (Texture texture, float x, float y, float originX, float originY, float width, float height, float scaleX,
417                      float scaleY, float rotation, int srcX, int srcY, int srcWidth, int srcHeight, boolean flipX, boolean flipY) {
418        if (!drawing) throw new IllegalStateException("ColorfulBatch.begin must be called before draw.");
419
420        float[] vertices = this.vertices;
421
422        if (texture != lastTexture)
423            switchTexture(texture);
424        else if (idx == vertices.length) //
425            flush();
426
427        // bottom left and top right corner points relative to origin
428        final float worldOriginX = x + originX;
429        final float worldOriginY = y + originY;
430        float fx = -originX;
431        float fy = -originY;
432        float fx2 = width - originX;
433        float fy2 = height - originY;
434
435        // scale
436        if (scaleX != 1 || scaleY != 1) {
437            fx *= scaleX;
438            fy *= scaleY;
439            fx2 *= scaleX;
440            fy2 *= scaleY;
441        }
442
443        // construct corner points, start from top left and go counter clockwise
444        final float p1x = fx;
445        final float p1y = fy;
446        final float p2x = fx;
447        final float p2y = fy2;
448        final float p3x = fx2;
449        final float p3y = fy2;
450        final float p4x = fx2;
451        final float p4y = fy;
452
453        float x1;
454        float y1;
455        float x2;
456        float y2;
457        float x3;
458        float y3;
459        float x4;
460        float y4;
461
462        // rotate
463        if (rotation != 0) {
464            final float cos = MathUtils.cosDeg(rotation);
465            final float sin = MathUtils.sinDeg(rotation);
466
467            x1 = cos * p1x - sin * p1y;
468            y1 = sin * p1x + cos * p1y;
469
470            x2 = cos * p2x - sin * p2y;
471            y2 = sin * p2x + cos * p2y;
472
473            x3 = cos * p3x - sin * p3y;
474            y3 = sin * p3x + cos * p3y;
475
476            x4 = x1 + (x3 - x2);
477            y4 = y3 - (y2 - y1);
478        } else {
479            x1 = p1x;
480            y1 = p1y;
481
482            x2 = p2x;
483            y2 = p2y;
484
485            x3 = p3x;
486            y3 = p3y;
487
488            x4 = p4x;
489            y4 = p4y;
490        }
491
492        x1 += worldOriginX;
493        y1 += worldOriginY;
494        x2 += worldOriginX;
495        y2 += worldOriginY;
496        x3 += worldOriginX;
497        y3 += worldOriginY;
498        x4 += worldOriginX;
499        y4 += worldOriginY;
500
501        float u = srcX * invTexWidth;
502        float v = (srcY + srcHeight) * invTexHeight;
503        float u2 = (srcX + srcWidth) * invTexWidth;
504        float v2 = srcY * invTexHeight;
505
506        if (flipX) {
507            float tmp = u;
508            u = u2;
509            u2 = tmp;
510        }
511
512        if (flipY) {
513            float tmp = v;
514            v = v2;
515            v2 = tmp;
516        }
517
518        final float color = this.color;
519        final float tweak = this.tweak;
520        final int idx = this.idx;
521        vertices[idx] = x1;
522        vertices[idx + 1] = y1;
523        vertices[idx + 2] = color;
524        vertices[idx + 3] = u;
525        vertices[idx + 4] = v;
526        vertices[idx + 5] = tweak;
527
528        vertices[idx + 6] = x2;
529        vertices[idx + 7] = y2;
530        vertices[idx + 8] = color;
531        vertices[idx + 9] = u;
532        vertices[idx + 10] = v2;
533        vertices[idx + 11] = tweak;
534
535        vertices[idx + 12] = x3;
536        vertices[idx + 13] = y3;
537        vertices[idx + 14] = color;
538        vertices[idx + 15] = u2;
539        vertices[idx + 16] = v2;
540        vertices[idx + 17] = tweak;
541
542        vertices[idx + 18] = x4;
543        vertices[idx + 19] = y4;
544        vertices[idx + 20] = color;
545        vertices[idx + 21] = u2;
546        vertices[idx + 22] = v;
547        vertices[idx + 23] = tweak;
548        this.idx = idx + 24;
549    }
550
551    @Override
552    public void draw (Texture texture, float x, float y, float width, float height, int srcX, int srcY, int srcWidth,
553                      int srcHeight, boolean flipX, boolean flipY) {
554        if (!drawing) throw new IllegalStateException("ColorfulBatch.begin must be called before draw.");
555
556        float[] vertices = this.vertices;
557
558        if (texture != lastTexture)
559            switchTexture(texture);
560        else if (idx == vertices.length) //
561            flush();
562
563        float u = srcX * invTexWidth;
564        float v = (srcY + srcHeight) * invTexHeight;
565        float u2 = (srcX + srcWidth) * invTexWidth;
566        float v2 = srcY * invTexHeight;
567        final float fx2 = x + width;
568        final float fy2 = y + height;
569
570        if (flipX) {
571            float tmp = u;
572            u = u2;
573            u2 = tmp;
574        }
575
576        if (flipY) {
577            float tmp = v;
578            v = v2;
579            v2 = tmp;
580        }
581
582        final float color = this.color;
583        final float tweak = this.tweak;
584        final int idx = this.idx;
585        vertices[idx] = x;
586        vertices[idx + 1] = y;
587        vertices[idx + 2] = color;
588        vertices[idx + 3] = u;
589        vertices[idx + 4] = v;
590        vertices[idx + 5] = tweak;
591
592        vertices[idx + 6] = x;
593        vertices[idx + 7] = fy2;
594        vertices[idx + 8] = color;
595        vertices[idx + 9] = u;
596        vertices[idx + 10] = v2;
597        vertices[idx + 11] = tweak;
598
599        vertices[idx + 12] = fx2;
600        vertices[idx + 13] = fy2;
601        vertices[idx + 14] = color;
602        vertices[idx + 15] = u2;
603        vertices[idx + 16] = v2;
604        vertices[idx + 17] = tweak;
605
606        vertices[idx + 18] = fx2;
607        vertices[idx + 19] = y;
608        vertices[idx + 20] = color;
609        vertices[idx + 21] = u2;
610        vertices[idx + 22] = v;
611        vertices[idx + 23] = tweak;
612        this.idx = idx + 24;
613    }
614
615    @Override
616    public void draw (Texture texture, float x, float y, int srcX, int srcY, int srcWidth, int srcHeight) {
617        if (!drawing) throw new IllegalStateException("ColorfulBatch.begin must be called before draw.");
618
619        float[] vertices = this.vertices;
620
621        if (texture != lastTexture)
622            switchTexture(texture);
623        else if (idx == vertices.length) //
624            flush();
625
626        final float u = srcX * invTexWidth;
627        final float v = (srcY + srcHeight) * invTexHeight;
628        final float u2 = (srcX + srcWidth) * invTexWidth;
629        final float v2 = srcY * invTexHeight;
630        final float fx2 = x + srcWidth;
631        final float fy2 = y + srcHeight;
632
633        final float color = this.color;
634        final float tweak = this.tweak;
635        final int idx = this.idx;

663        this.idx = idx + 24;

672        if (texture != lastTexture)
673            switchTexture(texture);
674        else if (idx == vertices.length) //
675            flush();
676

679
680        final float color = this.color;
681        final float tweak = this.tweak;
682        final int idx = this.idx;
683        vertices[idx] = x;
684        vertices[idx + 1] = y;
685        vertices[idx + 2] = color;

717
718    @Override
719    public void draw (Texture texture, float x, float y, float width, float height) {
720        if (!drawing) throw new IllegalStateException("ColorfulBatch.begin must be called before draw.");
721
722        float[] vertices = this.vertices;
723
724        if (texture != lastTexture)
725            switchTexture(texture);
726        else if (idx == vertices.length) //
727            flush();
728
729        final float fx2 = x + width;
730        final float fy2 = y + height;
731        final float u = 0;
732        final float v = 1;
733        final float u2 = 1;
734        final float v2 = 0;
735
736        final float color = this.color;
737        final float tweak = this.tweak;
738        final int idx = this.idx;
739        vertices[idx] = x;
740        vertices[idx + 1] = y;
741        vertices[idx + 2] = color;
742        vertices[idx + 3] = u;
743        vertices[idx + 4] = v;
744        vertices[idx + 5] = tweak;
745
746        vertices[idx + 6] = x;
747        vertices[idx + 7] = fy2;
748        vertices[idx + 8] = color;
749        vertices[idx + 9] = u;
750        vertices[idx + 10] = v2;
751        vertices[idx + 11] = tweak;
752
753        vertices[idx + 12] = fx2;
754        vertices[idx + 13] = fy2;
755        vertices[idx + 14] = color;
756        vertices[idx + 15] = u2;
757        vertices[idx + 16] = v2;
758        vertices[idx + 17] = tweak;
759
760        vertices[idx + 18] = fx2;
761        vertices[idx + 19] = y;
762        vertices[idx + 20] = color;
763        vertices[idx + 21] = u2;
764        vertices[idx + 22] = v;
765        vertices[idx + 23] = tweak;
766        this.idx = idx + 24;
767    }
768
769    /**
770     * This is very different from the other overloads in this class; it assumes the float array it is given is in the
771     * format libGDX uses to give to SpriteBatch, that is, in groups of 20 floats per sprite. ColorfulBatch uses 24
772     * floats per sprite, to add tweak per color, so this does some conversion.
773     * @param texture the Texture being drawn from; usually an atlas or some parent Texture with lots of TextureRegions
774     * @param spriteVertices not the same format as {@link #vertices} in this class; should have a length that's a multiple of 20
775     * @param offset where to start drawing vertices from {@code spriteVertices}
776     * @param count how many vertices to draw from {@code spriteVertices} (20 vertices is one sprite)
777     */
778    @Override
779    public void draw (Texture texture, float[] spriteVertices, int offset, int count) {
780        if (!drawing) throw new IllegalStateException("ColorfulBatch.begin must be called before draw.");
781
782        count = (count / 5) * 6;
783        int verticesLength = vertices.length;
784        int remainingVertices = verticesLength;
785        if (texture != lastTexture)
786            switchTexture(texture);
787        else {
788            remainingVertices -= idx;
789            if (remainingVertices == 0) {
790                flush();
791                remainingVertices = verticesLength;
792            }
793        }
794        int copyCount = Math.min(remainingVertices, count);
795        final float tweak = this.tweak;
796
797        ////old way, breaks when libGDX code expects SPRITE_SIZE to be 20
798        //System.arraycopy(spriteVertices, offset, vertices, idx, copyCount);
799        ////new way, thanks mgsx
800        for (int s = offset, v = idx, i = 0; i < copyCount; i += 6) {
801            vertices[v++] = spriteVertices[s++];
802            vertices[v++] = spriteVertices[s++];
803            vertices[v++] = spriteVertices[s++];
804            vertices[v++] = spriteVertices[s++];
805            vertices[v++] = spriteVertices[s++];
806            vertices[v++] = tweak;
807        }
808        idx += copyCount;
809        count -= copyCount;
810        while (count > 0) {
811            offset += (copyCount / 6) * 5;
812            flush();
813            copyCount = Math.min(verticesLength, count);
814            ////old way, breaks when libGDX code expects SPRITE_SIZE to be 20
815            //System.arraycopy(spriteVertices, offset, vertices, 0, copyCount);
816            ////new way, thanks mgsx
817            for (int s = offset, v = 0, i = 0; i < copyCount; i += 6) {
818                vertices[v++] = spriteVertices[s++];
819                vertices[v++] = spriteVertices[s++];
820                vertices[v++] = spriteVertices[s++];
821                vertices[v++] = spriteVertices[s++];
822                vertices[v++] = spriteVertices[s++];
823                vertices[v++] = tweak;
824            }
825            idx += copyCount;
826            count -= copyCount;
827        }
828    }
829
830    /**
831     * Meant for code that uses ColorfulBatch specifically and can set an extra float (for the color tweak) per vertex,
832     * this is just like {@link #draw(Texture, float[], int, int)} when used in other Batch implementations, but expects
833     * {@code spriteVertices} to have a length that is a multiple of 24 instead of 20.
834     * @param texture the Texture being drawn from; usually an atlas or some parent Texture with lots of TextureRegions
835     * @param spriteVertices vertices formatted as this class uses them; length should be a multiple of 24
836     * @param offset where to start drawing vertices from {@code spriteVertices}
837     * @param count how many vertices to draw from {@code spriteVertices} (24 vertices is one sprite)
838     */
839    public void drawExactly (Texture texture, float[] spriteVertices, int offset, int count) {
840        if (!drawing) throw new IllegalStateException("ColorfulBatch.begin must be called before draw.");
841
842        int verticesLength = vertices.length;
843        int remainingVertices = verticesLength;
844        if (texture != lastTexture)
845            switchTexture(texture);
846        else {
847            remainingVertices -= idx;
848            if (remainingVertices == 0) {
849                flush();
850                remainingVertices = verticesLength;
851            }
852        }
853        int copyCount = Math.min(remainingVertices, count);
854
855        System.arraycopy(spriteVertices, offset, vertices, idx, copyCount);
856        idx += copyCount;
857        count -= copyCount;
858        while (count > 0) {
859            offset += copyCount;
860            flush();
861            copyCount = Math.min(verticesLength, count);
862            System.arraycopy(spriteVertices, offset, vertices, 0, copyCount);
863            idx += copyCount;
864            count -= copyCount;
865        }
866    }
867
868    @Override
869    public void draw (TextureRegion region, float x, float y) {
870        draw(region, x, y, region.getRegionWidth(), region.getRegionHeight());
871    }
872
873    @Override
874    public void draw (TextureRegion region, float x, float y, float width, float height) {
875        if (!drawing) throw new IllegalStateException("ColorfulBatch.begin must be called before draw.");
876
877        float[] vertices = this.vertices;
878
879        Texture texture = region.getTexture();
880        if (texture != lastTexture) {
881            switchTexture(texture);
882        } else if (idx == vertices.length) {
883            flush();
884        }
885        final float fx2 = x + width;
886        final float fy2 = y + height;
887        final float u = region.getU();
888        final float v = region.getV2();
889        final float u2 = region.getU2();
890        final float v2 = region.getV();
891
892        final float color = this.color;
893        final float tweak = this.tweak;
894        final int idx = this.idx;
895        vertices[idx] = x;
896        vertices[idx + 1] = y;
897        vertices[idx + 2] = color;
898        vertices[idx + 3] = u;
899        vertices[idx + 4] = v;
900        vertices[idx + 5] = tweak;
901
902        vertices[idx + 6] = x;
903        vertices[idx + 7] = fy2;
904        vertices[idx + 8] = color;
905        vertices[idx + 9] = u;
906        vertices[idx + 10] = v2;
907        vertices[idx + 11] = tweak;
908
909        vertices[idx + 12] = fx2;
910        vertices[idx + 13] = fy2;
911        vertices[idx + 14] = color;
912        vertices[idx + 15] = u2;
913        vertices[idx + 16] = v2;
914        vertices[idx + 17] = tweak;
915
916        vertices[idx + 18] = fx2;
917        vertices[idx + 19] = y;
918        vertices[idx + 20] = color;
919        vertices[idx + 21] = u2;
920        vertices[idx + 22] = v;
921        vertices[idx + 23] = tweak;
922        this.idx = idx + 24;
923    }
924
925    @Override
926    public void draw (TextureRegion region, float x, float y, float originX, float originY, float width, float height,
927                      float scaleX, float scaleY, float rotation) {
928        if (!drawing) throw new IllegalStateException("ColorfulBatch.begin must be called before draw.");
929
930        float[] vertices = this.vertices;
931
932        Texture texture = region.getTexture();
933        if (texture != lastTexture) {
934            switchTexture(texture);
935        } else if (idx == vertices.length) //
936            flush();
937
938        // bottom left and top right corner points relative to origin
939        final float worldOriginX = x + originX;
940        final float worldOriginY = y + originY;
941        float fx = -originX;
942        float fy = -originY;
943        float fx2 = width - originX;
944        float fy2 = height - originY;
945
946        // scale
947        if (scaleX != 1 || scaleY != 1) {
948            fx *= scaleX;
949            fy *= scaleY;
950            fx2 *= scaleX;
951            fy2 *= scaleY;
952        }
953
954        // construct corner points, start from top left and go counter clockwise
955        final float p1x = fx;
956        final float p1y = fy;
957        final float p2x = fx;
958        final float p2y = fy2;
959        final float p3x = fx2;
960        final float p3y = fy2;
961        final float p4x = fx2;
962        final float p4y = fy;
963
964        float x1;
965        float y1;
966        float x2;
967        float y2;
968        float x3;
969        float y3;
970        float x4;
971        float y4;
972
973        // rotate
974        if (rotation != 0) {
975            final float cos = MathUtils.cosDeg(rotation);
976            final float sin = MathUtils.sinDeg(rotation);
977
978            x1 = cos * p1x - sin * p1y;
979            y1 = sin * p1x + cos * p1y;
980
981            x2 = cos * p2x - sin * p2y;
982            y2 = sin * p2x + cos * p2y;
983
984            x3 = cos * p3x - sin * p3y;
985            y3 = sin * p3x + cos * p3y;
986
987            x4 = x1 + (x3 - x2);
988            y4 = y3 - (y2 - y1);
989        } else {
990            x1 = p1x;
991            y1 = p1y;
992
993            x2 = p2x;
994            y2 = p2y;
995
996            x3 = p3x;
997            y3 = p3y;
998
999            x4 = p4x;
1000            y4 = p4y;
1001        }
1002
1003        x1 += worldOriginX;
1004        y1 += worldOriginY;
1005        x2 += worldOriginX;
1006        y2 += worldOriginY;
1007        x3 += worldOriginX;
1008        y3 += worldOriginY;
1009        x4 += worldOriginX;
1010        y4 += worldOriginY;
1011
1012        final float u = region.getU();
1013        final float v = region.getV2();
1014        final float u2 = region.getU2();
1015        final float v2 = region.getV();
1016
1017        final float color = this.color;
1018        final float tweak = this.tweak;
1019        final int idx = this.idx;
1020        vertices[idx] = x1;
1021        vertices[idx + 1] = y1;
1022        vertices[idx + 2] = color;
1023        vertices[idx + 3] = u;
1024        vertices[idx + 4] = v;
1025        vertices[idx + 5] = tweak;
1026
1027        vertices[idx + 6] = x2;
1028        vertices[idx + 7] = y2;
1029        vertices[idx + 8] = color;
1030        vertices[idx + 9] = u;
1031        vertices[idx + 10] = v2;
1032        vertices[idx + 11] = tweak;
1033
1034        vertices[idx + 12] = x3;
1035        vertices[idx + 13] = y3;
1036        vertices[idx + 14] = color;
1037        vertices[idx + 15] = u2;
1038        vertices[idx + 16] = v2;
1039        vertices[idx + 17] = tweak;
1040
1041        vertices[idx + 18] = x4;
1042        vertices[idx + 19] = y4;
1043        vertices[idx + 20] = color;
1044        vertices[idx + 21] = u2;
1045        vertices[idx + 22] = v;
1046        vertices[idx + 23] = tweak;
1047        this.idx = idx + 24;
1048    }
1049
1050    @Override
1051    public void draw (TextureRegion region, float x, float y, float originX, float originY, float width, float height,
1052                      float scaleX, float scaleY, float rotation, boolean clockwise) {
1053        if (!drawing) throw new IllegalStateException("ColorfulBatch.begin must be called before draw.");
1054
1055        float[] vertices = this.vertices;
1056
1057        Texture texture = region.getTexture();
1058        if (texture != lastTexture) {
1059            switchTexture(texture);
1060        } else if (idx == vertices.length) //
1061            flush();
1062
1063        // bottom left and top right corner points relative to origin
1064        final float worldOriginX = x + originX;
1065        final float worldOriginY = y + originY;
1066        float fx = -originX;
1067        float fy = -originY;
1068        float fx2 = width - originX;
1069        float fy2 = height - originY;
1070
1071        // scale
1072        if (scaleX != 1 || scaleY != 1) {
1073            fx *= scaleX;
1074            fy *= scaleY;
1075            fx2 *= scaleX;
1076            fy2 *= scaleY;
1077        }
1078
1079        // construct corner points, start from top left and go counter clockwise
1080        final float p1x = fx;
1081        final float p1y = fy;
1082        final float p2x = fx;
1083        final float p2y = fy2;
1084        final float p3x = fx2;
1085        final float p3y = fy2;
1086        final float p4x = fx2;
1087        final float p4y = fy;
1088
1089        float x1;
1090        float y1;
1091        float x2;
1092        float y2;
1093        float x3;
1094        float y3;
1095        float x4;
1096        float y4;
1097
1098        // rotate
1099        if (rotation != 0) {
1100            final float cos = MathUtils.cosDeg(rotation);
1101            final float sin = MathUtils.sinDeg(rotation);
1102
1103            x1 = cos * p1x - sin * p1y;
1104            y1 = sin * p1x + cos * p1y;
1105
1106            x2 = cos * p2x - sin * p2y;
1107            y2 = sin * p2x + cos * p2y;
1108
1109            x3 = cos * p3x - sin * p3y;
1110            y3 = sin * p3x + cos * p3y;
1111
1112            x4 = x1 + (x3 - x2);
1113            y4 = y3 - (y2 - y1);
1114        } else {
1115            x1 = p1x;
1116            y1 = p1y;
1117
1118            x2 = p2x;
1119            y2 = p2y;
1120
1121            x3 = p3x;
1122            y3 = p3y;
1123
1124            x4 = p4x;
1125            y4 = p4y;
1126        }
1127
1128        x1 += worldOriginX;
1129        y1 += worldOriginY;
1130        x2 += worldOriginX;
1131        y2 += worldOriginY;
1132        x3 += worldOriginX;
1133        y3 += worldOriginY;
1134        x4 += worldOriginX;
1135        y4 += worldOriginY;
1136
1137        float u1, v1, u2, v2, u3, v3, u4, v4;
1138        if (clockwise) {
1139            u1 = region.getU2();
1140            v1 = region.getV2();
1141            u2 = region.getU();
1142            v2 = region.getV2();
1143            u3 = region.getU();
1144            v3 = region.getV();
1145            u4 = region.getU2();
1146            v4 = region.getV();
1147        } else {
1148            u1 = region.getU();
1149            v1 = region.getV();
1150            u2 = region.getU2();
1151            v2 = region.getV();
1152            u3 = region.getU2();
1153            v3 = region.getV2();
1154            u4 = region.getU();
1155            v4 = region.getV2();
1156        }
1157
1158        final float color = this.color;
1159        final float tweak = this.tweak;
1160        final int idx = this.idx;
1161        vertices[idx] = x1;
1162        vertices[idx + 1] = y1;
1163        vertices[idx + 2] = color;
1164        vertices[idx + 3] = u1;
1165        vertices[idx + 4] = v1;
1166        vertices[idx + 5] = tweak;
1167
1168        vertices[idx + 6] = x2;
1169        vertices[idx + 7] = y2;
1170        vertices[idx + 8] = color;
1171        vertices[idx + 9] = u2;
1172        vertices[idx + 10] = v2;
1173        vertices[idx + 11] = tweak;
1174
1175        vertices[idx + 12] = x3;
1176        vertices[idx + 13] = y3;
1177        vertices[idx + 14] = color;
1178        vertices[idx + 15] = u3;
1179        vertices[idx + 16] = v3;
1180        vertices[idx + 17] = tweak;
1181
1182        vertices[idx + 18] = x4;
1183        vertices[idx + 19] = y4;
1184        vertices[idx + 20] = color;
1185        vertices[idx + 21] = u4;
1186        vertices[idx + 22] = v4;
1187        vertices[idx + 23] = tweak;
1188        this.idx = idx + 24;
1189    }
1190
1191    @Override
1192    public void draw (TextureRegion region, float width, float height, Affine2 transform) {
1193        if (!drawing) throw new IllegalStateException("ColorfulBatch.begin must be called before draw.");
1194
1195        float[] vertices = this.vertices;
1196
1197        Texture texture = region.getTexture();
1198        if (texture != lastTexture) {
1199            switchTexture(texture);
1200        } else if (idx == vertices.length) {
1201            flush();
1202        }
1203
1204        // construct corner points
1205        float x1 = transform.m02;
1206        float y1 = transform.m12;
1207        float x2 = transform.m01 * height + transform.m02;
1208        float y2 = transform.m11 * height + transform.m12;
1209        float x3 = transform.m00 * width + transform.m01 * height + transform.m02;
1210        float y3 = transform.m10 * width + transform.m11 * height + transform.m12;
1211        float x4 = transform.m00 * width + transform.m02;
1212        float y4 = transform.m10 * width + transform.m12;
1213
1214        float u = region.getU();
1215        float v = region.getV2();
1216        float u2 = region.getV2();
1217        float v2 = region.getV();
1218
1219        final float color = this.color;
1220        final float tweak = this.tweak;
1221        final int idx = this.idx;
1222        vertices[idx] = x1;
1223        vertices[idx + 1] = y1;
1224        vertices[idx + 2] = color;
1225        vertices[idx + 3] = u;
1226        vertices[idx + 4] = v;
1227        vertices[idx + 5] = tweak;
1228
1229        vertices[idx + 6] = x2;
1230        vertices[idx + 7] = y2;
1231        vertices[idx + 8] = color;
1232        vertices[idx + 9] = u;
1233        vertices[idx + 10] = v2;
1234        vertices[idx + 11] = tweak;
1235
1236        vertices[idx + 12] = x3;
1237        vertices[idx + 13] = y3;
1238        vertices[idx + 14] = color;
1239        vertices[idx + 15] = u2;
1240        vertices[idx + 16] = v2;
1241        vertices[idx + 17] = tweak;
1242
1243        vertices[idx + 18] = x4;
1244        vertices[idx + 19] = y4;
1245        vertices[idx + 20] = color;
1246        vertices[idx + 21] = u2;
1247        vertices[idx + 22] = v;
1248        vertices[idx + 23] = tweak;
1249        this.idx = idx + 24;
1250    }
1251
1252    @SuppressWarnings("RedundantCast") // These casts are absolutely not redundant! Java 9 changed Buffer ABI.
1253    @Override
1254    public void flush () {
1255        if (idx == 0) return;
1256
1257        renderCalls++;
1258        totalRenderCalls++;
1259        int spritesInBatch = idx / SPRITE_SIZE;
1260        if (spritesInBatch > maxSpritesInBatch) maxSpritesInBatch = spritesInBatch;
1261        int count = spritesInBatch * 6;
1262
1263        lastTexture.bind();
1264        Mesh mesh = this.mesh;
1265        mesh.setVertices(vertices, 0, idx);
1266        ((Buffer)mesh.getIndicesBuffer()).position(0);
1267        ((Buffer)mesh.getIndicesBuffer()).limit(count);
1268
1269        if (blendingDisabled) {
1270            Gdx.gl.glDisable(GL20.GL_BLEND);
1271        } else {
1272            Gdx.gl.glEnable(GL20.GL_BLEND);
1273            if (blendSrcFunc != -1) Gdx.gl.glBlendFuncSeparate(blendSrcFunc, blendDstFunc, blendSrcFuncAlpha, blendDstFuncAlpha);
1274        }
1275
1276        mesh.render(customShader != null ? customShader : shader, GL20.GL_TRIANGLES, 0, count);
1277
1278        idx = 0;
1279    }
1280
1281    @Override
1282    public void disableBlending () {
1283        if (blendingDisabled) return;
1284        flush();
1285        blendingDisabled = true;
1286    }
1287
1288    @Override
1289    public void enableBlending () {
1290        if (!blendingDisabled) return;
1291        flush();
1292        blendingDisabled = false;
1293    }
1294
1295    @Override
1296    public void setBlendFunction (int srcFunc, int dstFunc) {
1297        setBlendFunctionSeparate(srcFunc, dstFunc, srcFunc, dstFunc);
1298    }
1299
1300    @Override
1301    public void setBlendFunctionSeparate(int srcFuncColor, int dstFuncColor, int srcFuncAlpha, int dstFuncAlpha) {
1302        if (blendSrcFunc == srcFuncColor && blendDstFunc == dstFuncColor && blendSrcFuncAlpha == srcFuncAlpha && blendDstFuncAlpha == dstFuncAlpha) return;
1303        flush();
1304        blendSrcFunc = srcFuncColor;
1305        blendDstFunc = dstFuncColor;
1306        blendSrcFuncAlpha = srcFuncAlpha;
1307        blendDstFuncAlpha = dstFuncAlpha;
1308    }
1309
1310    @Override
1311    public int getBlendSrcFunc () {
1312        return blendSrcFunc;
1313    }
1314
1315    @Override
1316    public int getBlendDstFunc () {
1317        return blendDstFunc;
1318    }
1319
1320    @Override
1321    public int getBlendSrcFuncAlpha() {
1322        return blendSrcFuncAlpha;
1323    }
1324
1325    @Override
1326    public int getBlendDstFuncAlpha() {
1327        return blendDstFuncAlpha;
1328    }
1329
1330    @Override
1331    public void dispose () {
1332        mesh.dispose();
1333        if (ownsShader && shader != null) shader.dispose();
1334    }
1335
1336    @Override
1337    public Matrix4 getProjectionMatrix () {
1338        return projectionMatrix;
1339    }
1340
1341    @Override
1342    public Matrix4 getTransformMatrix () {
1343        return transformMatrix;
1344    }
1345
1346    @Override
1347    public void setProjectionMatrix (Matrix4 projection) {
1348        if (drawing) flush();
1349        projectionMatrix.set(projection);
1350        if (drawing) setupMatrices();
1351    }
1352
1353    @Override
1354    public void setTransformMatrix (Matrix4 transform) {
1355        if (drawing) flush();
1356        transformMatrix.set(transform);
1357        if (drawing) setupMatrices();
1358    }
1359
1360    protected void setupMatrices () {
1361        combinedMatrix.set(projectionMatrix).mul(transformMatrix);
1362        if (customShader != null) {
1363            customShader.setUniformMatrix("u_projTrans", combinedMatrix);
1364            customShader.setUniformi("u_texture", 0);
1365        } else {
1366            shader.setUniformMatrix("u_projTrans", combinedMatrix);
1367            shader.setUniformi("u_texture", 0);
1368        }
1369    }
1370
1371    protected void switchTexture (Texture texture) {
1372        flush();
1373        lastTexture = texture;
1374        invTexWidth = 1.0f / texture.getWidth();
1375        invTexHeight = 1.0f / texture.getHeight();
1376    }
1377
1378    @Override
1379    public void setShader (ShaderProgram shader) {
1380        if (drawing) {
1381            flush();
1382        }
1383        customShader = shader;
1384        if (drawing) {
1385            if (customShader != null)
1386                customShader.bind();
1387            else
1388                this.shader.bind();
1389            setupMatrices();
1390        }
1391    }
1392
1393    @Override
1394    public ShaderProgram getShader () {
1395        if (customShader == null) {
1396            return shader;
1397        }
1398        return customShader;
1399    }
1400
1401    @Override
1402    public boolean isBlendingEnabled () {
1403        return !blendingDisabled;
1404    }
1405
1406    public boolean isDrawing () {
1407        return drawing;
1408    }
1409    public static final int X1 = 0;
1410    public static final int Y1 = 1;
1411    public static final int C1 = 2;
1412    public static final int U1 = 3;
1413    public static final int V1 = 4;
1414    public static final int T1 = 5;
1415    public static final int X2 = 6;
1416    public static final int Y2 = 7;
1417    public static final int C2 = 8;
1418    public static final int U2 = 9;
1419    public static final int V2 = 10;
1420    public static final int T2 = 11;
1421    public static final int X3 = 12;
1422    public static final int Y3 = 13;
1423    public static final int C3 = 14;
1424    public static final int U3 = 15;
1425    public static final int V3 = 16;
1426    public static final int T3 = 17;
1427    public static final int X4 = 18;
1428    public static final int Y4 = 19;
1429    public static final int C4 = 20;
1430    public static final int U4 = 21;
1431    public static final int V4 = 22;
1432    public static final int T4 = 23;
1433}
